reviews.review_text: We shared a chefs tasting menu and sat at the Chefs bar. The entire experience was perfect. As we were being seated we were asked where we are from and they confirmed that it was a special occasion. The exceptional service continued throughout the evening. The food was exquisite. Vegan fare rarely rises to such heights. Attention was paid to presentation, flavor combinations, and textures. The Beet tartar and the chickpea tofu stood out to my mind, but nothing was wanting. The desserts were luscious. The chocolate layer cake with crunchy bottom, orange gelee, and a sprinkle of salt to heighten the senses was, like the rest of the meal a delight for the eyes and senses on multiple levels. The pear tart was perfectly cooked with the fruit holding its shape and texture, not too sweet, with a touch of cinnamon. I enjoyed a non-alcoholic beer and an NA gin and tonic that were recommended and I would gladly order again. My partner really enjoyed her whiskey cocktail (with alcohol) and her recommended glass of white wine. We will happily be back. Vegetarian options: Its a vegan restaurant. Dietary restrictions: They checked with us early on for any dietary restrictions. We had none, but they were clearly willing to accommodate.

Everything is AMAZING, cannot recommend Folke enough! My friends and I visited thinking we re just going to have another regular dinner but we were thoroughly blown away. Every dish was full of flavour, texture, and tastiness! The only dish we thought was okay was their dessert, but to top that off they had the best rhubarb caramel (which we would love to purchase, except they said that wasn t possible ughhh). Would definitely revisit Folke again. Their service was also exceptional and the food came out really fast as well!

This is my first time here and I was thoroughly impressed. They prioritize fair and equal wages for their staff, eliminating the need for gratuity, which undoubtedly contributes to the excellent service. The culinary experience was exceptional, with each dish showcasing the creativity of the chefs, proving that plant-based cuisine can be delicious and satisfying. The restaurants serene atmosphere, with its calming decor and lighting, made for a perfect setting for a tranquil meal. In summary, this all-vegan restaurant offers both a delightful dining experience and a commendable commitment to fair wages, making it a highly recommended choice for those seeking exceptional vegan cuisine.

My husband and I heard about Folke through a friend. We requested the sharing / wine pairing menu. It was absolutely fabulous! There were so many complex and nuanced flavours with each dish. We will be back!

Super unique and amazing vegan food with complex, unique flavors that really feature the vegetables and their flavors in unique and unexpected ways. So many vegan dishes and restaurants focus on the seasonings and sauces only but Folke chefs (magicians) really pull forward the natural flavors putting veggies herbs and legumes on center stage. If I wasn t already vegan, this dining experience would have surely turned me. Also, next level gourmet tater tots; tapioca mushroom dumpling were insane; fried chickpea tofu  so fantastic. We got the tasting menu which was incredible at only $85 CAD and little morsels of a bunch of different dishes so you get to try a lot of variety but plenty of food left us satisfied and full by the time dessert came. The best Michelin restaurant I ve been to yet! Vegetarian options: Gourmet vegan

10/10 experience - true vegan fine dining! All of the food was absolutely mind-blowing, and every staff member we interacted with was kind, attentive, helpful, genuine, and knowledgeable!!! A MUST go for anyone curious!!

Find yourself tasting and musing this meal while catching up with friends over a selection of tremendously well thought through and inspiring dishes of vegetarian fare. Small sharing items you intimately enjoy in a casual and calm environment paired with wine or finely crafted mocktails.

Wow, Wow, and Wow!  What a truly phenomenal culinary experience! This is a fine dining restaurant that serves amazing food and also just happens to be plant based. My husband and I had the Chefs Tasting with wine pairing while sitting at the counter looking in to the kitchen. Watching the chefs prepare our meal, as well as others, was so interesting.  Silly as it sounds, it was like watching a choreographed ballet to create an amazing meal!  Each dish was beautifully plated, incredibly delicious, with fresh local products, that were so tasty, satisfying and satiating.  We were so full at the end of the tasting menu!  The wine pairing was also so well thought out and each glass complimented the food perfectly! Each dish and glass of wine was presented with a brief explanation.  Everyone of the staff were very kind and we had the good fortune to meet Pricilla and Chef Colin the owners, who both took the time to visit with us and made us feel very welcome in their beautiful restaurant! I definitely recommend this restaurant and we will be back next time we are in Vancouver, as we were visiting from Los Angeles.   Thank you so much Stu from Good Dogs for recommending Folke to us!

What a sensational experience! My hubby and I have been on the search for a  fine dining  experience in Vancouver and I must say Folke out did itself! our expectations were blown out of the water! Everything tasted AMAZING! The menu is fabulous and changes as well with whatever local ingredients they get. The dishes are very flavorful & the ambiance is perfect! The owners are so sweet, they take their time to get to know you. Can t wait to come back soon!

I had high expectations going in, and they exceeded them. First of all, the quality of the service is among the best in the city. Despite the restaurant being full, our waiters were attentive, knowledgeable, and super-friendly. Folke has also progressed beyond the West s barbaric and primitive tipping culture by simply paying staff properly. Kudos for that. We had the tasting menu with wine pairing, and all of the food was spectacular. The bolognese and the tagliatelle were the best vegan dishes I ve had. Portions were a bit small, but I was comfortably full afterwards. Admirably, the restaurant uses lesser-known wineries, many from Vancouver Island, which despite not being known for producing good wine, made for some interesting pairings (and a few bad ones). All 3 cocktails were great, my favorite being the gin one. Easily the best vegan restaurant in Vancouver. I ll return often!

I ve been here twice and so far it has been a wonderful experience! My husband and I tried the Tasting Menu the other day which was delicious! I loved all the flavour and textures in every dish and love that they have something different to offer plus it feels healthy and nourishing which can sometimes feel hard to find for vegan dishes. Plus the desserts were INCREDIBLE! Priscilla is also super sweet and accomodating with her helpful suggestions. Hands down one of fav vegan fine dining experiences - incredible service, staff and the fact that it s all vegan is a win all around! After living overseas, I also love the no tip model so wages are fair for staff. Can t wait to come back and try more!

While I love my meat, this restaurant definitely changed how I feel about vegan/vegetarian food. Our meal was delicious! I still cant stop drooling over their Chickpea Tofu. Everything was prepared with thought and care and it makes you savour every bite! The staff was fantastic and I love that their pricing includes their hospitality. Such a great concept! Would highly recommend this place!
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank you so much! We loved having you!

reviews.review_text: Delicious. Everything we ordered was yummy but the broccoli and potato were my favourite! The dumplings had such a wonderful texture. Service was amazing and very friendly. Great to see an all vegan place that doesn t serve junk food! Be aware that this is vegan fine dining, so if you re looking to be full for $20, this isn t the place for you.

lovely neighbourhood spot with tasty food, couldn t believe it was vegan! we came for the pop-up and were able to do a tasting menu version, loveddd the mochi and dumplings will come back for the regular menu!

I had the chefs choice multiple course meal and I am very happy that I did! The restaurant buys and uses local ingredients and turns them into delectable dishes   The menu changes according to the local produce. When I received the bill and asked how I can tip, the reply was that they dont take tips they get paid a fair wage The whole experience was fantastic and I cant recommend Folke enough Vegetarian options: Vegan!
Loved the food! We did the tasting menu and its so hard to pick a favourite, but I love the chickpea tofu. The dessert was so good too. We were amazed that it was vegan!

Best vegan food Ive eaten so far in Vancoucer this year, but be prepared to pay for it.  We looked at the menu too quickly and didnt realize the PP stood for per person, cost $300 for the  don t give a folke  with the wine pairing.  The experience was great and the people who work there are awesome. Thank you!

Thank you for the wonderful birthday experience! All the taste buds had an amazing treat. Lovely staff, beyond delicious food, and relaxing atmosphere. Perfectly executed food was the cherry on top! Food

Updated: We have been back several times in the year but once again we returned and there is a reason they earned a Michelin recommendation.  Service, Food and drinks, all exceptional. We love it here.  I highly recommend to try different seasons, more preserves and pickles in the winter/spring and end of summer great fruit and veggies. I cant wait to see what they do in the fall. Every visit makes me appreciate the mad scientists that these chefs are and what they do with fresh ingredients.  I stand by that the price is reasonable for the tasting menu. Based on one visit. We love vegetables but I was reluctant, it seemed a little pricey for veggies. I was wrong. We had the tasting menu for two which included all but one of the items on the menu. The pickles, the tomatoes, the beets, the shishito peppers, the beans, the potatoes, the dumplings, the noodles and the list goes on--- all served uniquely, well timed and well portioned, we each had our favorite but they were all close in being the best of the evening. The subtle use of charring, and the gentleness of their deep frying, the love of pickling fermenting and dehydrating ( I guess all preserves) was on the display, the attention to detail in the sauces, with each sauce complimenting the vegetable being served. The service was smart, leave the starch to the end, give enough time between servings to savour the flavours, that way we dont fill up because fill up we did. The flavours for the most part were asian influenced and were delightful plays on familiar dishes. We started with pickles and ended with a ramen, then a dessert.  The vegetables and the majority of the ingredients were all local The service was excellent kindness and helpfulness from all, one of the chefs periodically came out to serve our dish, explaining the details in each. The tasting menu was $75, I cannot imagine going in for anything less, it is great value, there is a lot of effort that is put into each dish. Compliments to the front of the house, the chef and dishwasher, our cutlery and plates were replaced between each course, that is rare these days. I also need to point out that there is no tipping, yes no tipping. I am sure if you left some cash on the table they would enjoy but each person working has skin in the game at Folke, they enjoy what they are creating and include the service in the prices. Congrats, we will return before the growing season is over and look forward to what you can do in the winter.

Amazing! The first time I tried to take my friend to a tasting menu (not at Folke) it wasnt great (every dish had salty/smoked? flavour), which was unfortunate because I had been trying to convince her to try one for a while. I convinced her to give it a second chance and this time we went to Folke, and we had so much fun experiencing the food! We have plans to go back the next time shes in town. Thank you, people of Folke!

Had a very enjoyable dinner here. The staff were incredibly attentive and friendly. They did a great job describing each dish and giving feedback and suggestions for what to order. We were sat at the counter by the kitchen and could watch the chefs preparing the food, which was very interesting. Each dish had very unique and distinct flavors. Its nice to have another option other than acorn for high-end vegan food but without the unreasonable price. The no tipping policy was a fantastic change from the usual. Vegetarian options: The entire menu is vegan

Food and wine was out of this world. Had the full taster menu and wine pairing for a special occasion and it was fantastic. The things you can do with a vegetable! Id highly recommend. I tipped and, to my amazement, they handed it back. Was a bit awkward as I just wanted to show my appreciation over and above but I respect the business for paying their staff accordingly. This place is well worth a visit.

So glad to find another amazing vegan restaurant! Loved the wine I ordered, it s a light, smooth and aromatic Rose wine: SEA STAR, intertidal 2021. Server was so kind and let me tasted it before I ordered :) Half portion is available for ordering if you are dining in just by yourself, or if you just want to try more dishes. bread: warm and soft, with red pepper dipping sauce. Mushroom dumpling: very flavorful, the dumpling dough is soft and chewy (even a little bit like mochi) Service is amazing every time. Washroom has cute wallpaper, very clean, and the hand soap smells nice. They also offer a free seaweed caramel when you pay the check! And It s even better than the ones you may find in a dessert shop.

Amazing plant based restaurant in Vancouver! So glad their motto is elevating vegetables instead of using imitation meat. Also, you MUST try their cocktails. I don t like whiskey and i LOVED their whisky cocktail. This restaurant is not to be missed
Such a lovely atmosphere, incredible cuisine and amazing staff! Cant say enough about this restaurant, you have to try it !

Folke is a one-of-a-kind gem in the heart of one of Vancouver s most idyllic neighbourhoods!! Do yourself a favour and visit this restaurant that is built on sustainability - both for the products carried and the people that work there. We sampled the tasting menu and every dish was exquisite. The chefs greet your table and explain each dish which helps understand their process and makes for a great and authentic dining experience. If you re a wine enthusiast (who isn t?), their selection of local BC wineries is a large step above the rest of Vancouver s dining options. 10/10!! I strongly recommend opting for the tasting menu as well! Can t wait to return!
Creative vegetarian. Some dishes a little heavy handed on the salt but overall a great experience.

My boyfriend and I came here for our anniversary and we had a fantastic experience. All the food that we tried was so so good, the tagliatelle is absolutely to die for. Our server Priscilla was so nice and had expert wine knowledge to top it all off. Well definitely be back!!
Tasty food, nice environment! Had a tasting menu today, very good! ( in general their food is bit salty , we had 3 bottles of water) lol

I came in for Izakaya night and had a few different dishes and the sake cocktail using local sake (Kizuna Sake). The sake cocktail was great with nice yuzu cranberry flavour and a hint of sweetness, very easy to drink. All the food was creative and so tasty, I couldnt believe its all vegan. It had lots of umami flavour. Great service and the best caramels at the emd of dinner that melt in your mouth. I am looking forward to dining their again to try more dishes.

My friend and I decided to go here a little last minute, but we were able to make a reservation on Sunday morning for 5:30 later that day. We had a fantastic time! Started off with a warm welcome from the staff into the restaurant. Decoration is on the simple side, but classy and welcoming. To start, our waitress offered to bring us samples of any of the drinks if we wanted to try something without committing. We were both really intrigued by the orange wine on the drink list since neither of us had tried orange wine before, so we asked for samples of that. They actually brought us each two samples: the wine from the menu, and another orange wine that they d just brought in and wasn t on the menu yet. The first tasted more conventional, the off-menu wine had a smoky taste yet went down easily. I was pretty into this one, but after two tastings I no longer felt the need for more alcohol, so I ended up ordering their Summer Soda instead, which was refreshing and only very mildly sweet. Our waitress advised us that for 2 people, they recommend 4-6 dishes, so we ordered the Beets, Tofu, Shishito, and Dumplings, plus the Plum dessert. The plates are all portioned for 2 people to share and the portions with this number of dishes worked out well for us - it was a very satisfying meal but I wasnt overstuffed. I think you could split the dinner plates with up to 4 people and everyone would still get a decent taste, but the dessert would be hard to split more than 2 ways, maybe 3. The plates were brought out one at a time, and someone from the kitchen explained each as they brought it. A few comments on each dish (they were all fantastic, this is just to give more detail than what you see on the menu) Beets: This was kind of like a tartare, and was served with crisps. I forget what they said the crisps were made of, but they were kind of different and very tasty, and also pretty light. I really liked the sweetness and floral notes in this one. Tofu: If I had to pick a favourite, this would be it! It was actually chickpea tofu, not soy tofu, which has its own texture and flavour. The tofu itself was very very nice, but the sauce ALMOST stole the show (and the radish, chile, and greens it was garnished with complimented the dish perfectly). I couldve eaten that sauce by the spoonful. Shishito: This was relatively straightforward: shishito peppers, potatoes, and pickled onions in a simple soy-based sauce. What stood out was how everything was cooked to perfection and the quality ingredients. Im not much of a potato person but I found myself enjoying the potatoes as much as the peppers here. Dumplings: Vietnamese-style mushroom filled dumplings in a light ponzu sauce. The flavours worked very well and the cooking was again top-notch. Plum: Fermented plum cake/tart with miso and citrus infusion, with cream and a crumble topping on the side! I loved that this included some unique flavours, yet even though the ingredients sound a little out there, it wasnt one of those things where you eat it and its overwhelming or strange at first, it was really very easy on the palate. Bonus Caramels: Not a proper dish we ordered off the menu, but they brought us each a caramel coated with nori flakes with our bills. I saved mine for the next day. The nori with the caramel was definitely a slightly funky combination, but I ultimately decided I was into it and it left me curious about other ways to incorporate nori in sweets, so this was a fun way to end the experience. Besides the great food, the staff was really amazing. Everyone was polite and passionate about the restaurant, and it was especially nice to be able to learn about the food directly from the chefs. This place could not have done anything better.
both food and service were fantastic. We did the tasting menu, and it was such a fun experience for a very special night. Would highly recommend, to non vegans as well!

Went there for dinner tonight and opted for the chefs tasting menu. Wow, what a memorable dining experience. A culinary adventure - with kind, and attentive staff . I appreciate that this establishment pays their employees proper salaried wages with benefits - and doesn t put that pressure on the customers through tipping. Highly recommend!

My girlfriend and I went here for a nice dinner a few months ago and we were delighted by the food and service. The food is creative, fresh, and incredibly flavourful. Were stoked to have a fine dining plant-based restaurant of this caliber in our neighbourhood.

Visited Folke for a celebratory dinner and had a great experience. We did the tasting menu with a gluten allergy. The food was excellent, dishes were brought out at the perfect times, and the service went above and beyond. The prices are a little on the higher end, but the restaurant provides their staff with good wages eliminating the need for tips. Worth every penny!

The best dining experience I ve ever had. The food was ridiculously good, fresh and consciously curated. Flavour explosion dish  after dish. Highly recommend the tasting menu. The team running Folke are very helpful and friendly. We had a party of six and everyone was blown away.

This is definitely my favourite restaurant in Vancouver. The service is amazing, great location, beautiful calming atmosphere and the food is to DIE FOR! With a weekly rotating menu, I m always surprised and look forward to my next visit before I even leave! Pricilla is a master pastry chef and makes the most unique incredible desserts. Every visit is an experience and Vancouver is so so lucky to have such an incredible elevate  Plant based restaurant! Kid-friendliness: The owners welcome children! They are so accommodating.

We are not vegan (or even vegetarian). Loved Folke - innovative flavour packed food in casual environment staff/owned by passionate people. From the beet salad with hazelnuts to rhubarb chocolate dessert the flavours popped and presentation wowed. Unique BC wine list carefully curated. Go now before there are line ups or hard to get reservations.
What a wonderful experience. The tasting menu was full of colors and flavours - each one unique! It was a lot of food for a great price. Highly recommend!!

What a great surprise! The food was excellent and full of flavour. We tried the chickpea tofu which was excellent, carrot that was surprisingly good, dumplings and beets. Everything was amazing. We also had the chocolate dessert which was decent. I will definitely go back to try more things. Portions are small but sharable. A must try place if you want a food experience!!
Excellent tasting menu with delicious and beautiful dishes. Highly recommend. We ll be back. Happens to be vegan- didn t miss the dairy or meat one bit.

What a delight to find in the area. The servers delight in explaining the meals, the food is prepared with care, the dishes in the tasting menu reflect local and seasonal offerings. They elevate vegan such that your meat eating friends will not leave hungry. Oh and that chocolate cherry dessert lives in my taste buds.
Went last night, waitress were all very friendly. Was a cool experience having cooks bring out food and breif you on what it was. We got the tasting menu which was incredible.

First of all, kudos to this restaurant for paying a living wage and not asking for tips. Second, wow - what an impressive experience. From seating to leaving we were treated wonderfully by Priscilla, the waitstaff and the kitchen. The food was excellent, Im shocked any review would refer to it as boring tbh. We had: New Potatoes (my favourite dish, so creamy and flavourful) Zucchini Kohlrabi Chilled Ramen Salad Between two people this ended up being more than enough food and the range of flavours across all the dishes was outstanding. Looking forward to coming back!
The tasting menu with wine pairings was amazing - well worth the money! Service was fast and excellent as well. We loved that gratuity was included in all pricing.
Creative dishes bringing the wholesome taste of the vegetables out. Very good value for money. Would love to visit on our next trip to Vancouver.
We had a fantastic time at Folke. Every course on the tasting menu was incredible. The number of dishes was very generous, more kept coming!

Folke is an outstanding vegetarian restaurant that I had the pleasure of dining at recently. The restaurants commitment to using fresh, high-quality ingredients and creating inventive dishes that cater to a variety of dietary needs and preferences is evident in every aspect of the dining experience. The food at Folke is exceptional, with a menu that features vegetarian and vegan dishes that are both delicious and nutritious. The service at Folke is also excellent, with friendly and attentive staff who are knowledgeable about the menu and eager to help diners make the best choices for their taste buds. They go above and beyond to ensure that every guest has a great experience, from recommending dishes to catering to specific dietary needs. Overall, Folke is an exceptional vegetarian restaurant that I highly recommend to anyone looking for a great dining experience. The food is delicious, the service is excellent, and the atmosphere is warm and inviting. Its clear that the restaurant is committed to providing its guests with the best possible dining experience, and I cant wait to return and try more of their amazing vegetarian dishes.

This restaurant is a must visit for vegans and non! Service is attentive, genuinely friendly, both Pricilla and I think her name was Camille(blonde young woman) were lovely! Food absolutely delicious!  I love the no tip concept. I highly recommend, we will be back, Thank you! Vegetarian options: Best Vegan in Vancouver!

I had the absolute best dining experience here. I ordered the tasting menu and everything was unique and delicious. The service was great with each dish brought out and described in great detail. Favorites were the chickpea tofu, and the pasta dish. Everything was so good though. Vegetarian options: The whole menu is vegan Dietary restrictions: They asked about dietary restrictions which left me with the impression that they could likely accomodate Parking: Free parking available within 300 meters in the neighborhood
Delicious and inventive. The chocolate desert was one of the highlights for us. They include tips in the prices - refreshing.
Excellent food: creative dishes, great flavourful and beautiful presentation. Service was very attentive and friendly.
awesome food and service! we can t wait to go back again

I loved a lot: the drink menu being all local is impressive, gratuity included, the tasting menu was very filling, dishes were satisfying. Service was  too good ; our conversation was getting  interrupted by the food and quality checks and the dishes were taken away so quickly, last tiny bit sometimes still on the plates/drinks. At the same time I appreciate the efficiency of that but just a tad slower would be great. Waiting a sec for a sentence to finish or just get a thumbs up perhaps for some more of the check ins might help. It was quite busy and they were super attentive. Thanks for a fabulous dinner. *Update: upon reflection after going to some other good restaurants, and wanting to return to them, I realize that I would not return to Folke because my sentences were interrupted so often by the service. Not everyone would care about this, and I acknowledge that the Folke service was super attentive, chipper, and friendly but if I m looking for a place to catch up with someone, it doesn t feel warm and inviting and I just didn t want to mislead anyone reading this review. Best wishes to them, and no regrets in trying the place. I m a meat eater so I have a lot of options for fancier places.
Incredible food and service. The chefs tasting menu was delicious. The plating was beautiful      ! And the staff was lovely. Dietary restrictions: All vegan menu

We were hungry and in the area and hopped into Folke because it was a full house and everyone seemed to be enjoying themselves. Its a share plates and vegan restaurant. The beets came highly recommended, and we loved it! We also got the squash, dumplings, chickpea tofu, tagliatelle, and a sweet potato dessert. It was hard to believe that everything was vegan but omg the food was pretty and the flavors were fantastic!!! Whether youre vegan or not, you gotta eat here. Theres a lovely vibe and it has a no-tip culture, which is refreshing to see.

Amazing restaurant that just opened in June featuring an all vegan menu! We did the chefs tasting menu and each course was delicious with unique flavors popping out at us! The non-alcoholic drinks we had were also creative and very tasty (they had what seemed like a great selection of wines, beers, ciders and cocktails available as well). The staff was fantastic, knowledgeable, and friendly. Could not have been a better dining experience!

Folke is a one of a kind restaurant - all of the staff are incredibly friendly as well as knowledgable. I asked the staff for their recommendations and decided to go with the cabbage and the plot orange wine. I was given the backstory for both dishes and was absolutely blown away! Ive never had a vegetable dish prepared as well as this!!! I highly recommend checking out Folke when you have the chance.

Amazing upscale/gourmet vegan shareables. Friendly and helpful staff. Just have them order for you. Workers are salaried with full benefits (no tips needed). Only restaurant in Vancouver with all salaried employees.

Wow! My partner and I came here, and it was probably the best dining we have had in Vancouver. We spent the rest of the night talking sbout it. Each dish was amazing and unique, the flavors all carefully thought out. Woke up the next morning thinking about how good the food was. The service was also great. They really knew the wines and the menu which was so helpful. I love the design of the menu. Each dish is created around a main component and the menu changes with what is available seasonally. The thought and creativity put into the food is just on point. Cant wait to come back and try the tasting menu.

My goodness! I may still be overjoyed from our meal last night, but I think that was the best dining experience I ve ever had. The service, the food, the perfect sized portions, the wine, and the dessert- I cannot recommend this place enough. It was so refreshing to eat vegan food thoughtfully prepared to focus on fresh local taste and not greasy food pretending to be meat. Even though the place was fully booked, we felt doted on and appreciated. Bravo Folke team, you found your biggest fan!
reviews.response_from_owner_text: We loved meeting you and your family! Thank you so much!

reviews.review_text: Really amazing dinner I had with my wife for her birthday. We are both long-term vegetarians, and we both thought this was the best fine dining vegan food weve ever tried. We both got the tasting menu, and thought it was a tremendous value given the quality. Service from Gabrielle is also excellent.

Folke is a fantastic restaurant that happens to be a vegan restaurant. I would highly recommend doing the tasting menu! Every dish my partner and I had connected beautifully to the next! And each course made us want to get the very last drop on the plate. You wont believe how creamy, rich and tasty plant-based food can be! Fantastic local wine selection and also completely unpretentious!

4.5 stars to be exact. Food was delicious. Service was great. Time in between dishes a tad long, but overshadowed by the depth of flavours and impeccable presentation. Overall a great experience that I would highly recommend.

I try to reserve 5 stars for what I consider memorable experiences, and this was certainly one. We took the tasting menu, and it was fabulous. Not posting pictures, you are encouraged to find-out for yourself. Delicious, long succession of vegan dishes that any culinary aficionado will enjoy. Service is  included in the listed price, which is wonderful, too. Interesting dishes, at a reasonable price for their ingenuity and quality. The room is a bit loud, and the menu describes little about the dishes. You get the intricate details about each one verbally, from the friendly wait staff, or all three of the chefs, too, in our case. It is sometimes hard to hear and follow everything that is being explained. FOLKE is definitely a place to visit while it is here.

Absolutely incredible 10/10 experience from the entire team. From on the floor owners to host, bev manager and server as well as the chef team who came out to present each dish of our endless tasting menu. Each dish an absolute standout. Decor is tasteful and very well done. Chefs bar is a lovely touch for the up close and personal experience. Loved every minute of the whole experience. Thanks for also not rushing us! It was too lovely to rush. Looking forward to coming back and bringing more and more people to see what quality Vancouver dining can be.
The best vegan food I have ever had! Such creative options, friendly servers, and great wine!
Tight room but everything else was great! I am not a vegetarian but the food was fantastic!

Folke is located where Mistral was previously, in a cozy space on West Broadway in Kits. A vegetarian restaurant; one attractive draw was the prices include gratuity: In a unique take for this city, the restaurant pays its employees well, including benefits. We asked our server, who confirmed how it was great for her as this policy takes financial care of the servers,  and removes instability regarding wages. The owner, Priscilla, is engaging, warm, friendly; we had a lovely conversation with her towards the end of our meal. We had the tasting menu, amongst 5 girlfriends. A word to describe the food: fresh. Also: unexpected and delicious flavours, including a beet tartare not to be missed, a Vietnamese inspired dumpling, the cabbage dish still makes my mouth water, and the show-stopping pastas: bolognese and pizzocheri will make you wonder why we use noodles at all. We tried every dish on the menu and then some off menu; there wasnt a single disappointment. Despite generous servings, the beautiful dishes were emptied, which meant the mild regret of few leftovers the next day. I want places like this to thrive, for the amazing food offerings, and moreover for the influence it may have over other restaurants to consider the inclusion of gratuity for their servers.

This is my new favourite restaurant in Vancouver. Dishes are very flavourful and inventive. Service is excellent. Dont let the Vegan label turn you off, its truly excellent and worthy of a Michelin star.

Absolutely loved our experience at Folke. I definitely recommend going here if youre looking for a more fine dining experience with friendly and relaxed atmosphere. All of the staff were warm and friendly, and made us feel really welcome. We treated ourselved to the chefs menu and every single dish was delightful, their bread absolutely blew my mind.   Cant wait to come back!

Incredible experience, one of the best vegan meals Ive had in Vancouver. Should be on anybodys list of top vegan places to try in the city.  Love that they follow a no-tip option and really support the staff, it all comes through in the dishes and service.

I seldom write reviews but felt this needed one immediately. The food was so well crafted and had so many different textures, flavours and spices that complemented eachother in a way that made you savour the food. Our server Jessica was so authentic and passionate and made such an impact on our dining experience and our evening. Will 100% come back!!!

I havent eaten here but felt compelled to applaud the No Tipping policy. This is such a simple fix for the problems inherent in tipping. My wife is vegetarian and we will certainly visit next time we are in the big smoke. It will be our first meal in a restaurant in years due solely to forced guilt tipping. Bravo!

Astonishingly good, creative, vegan fine-dining with warm and attentive service and an urbane ambiance. It opened only a few weeks ago and just might have become the best vegan restaurant in Vancouver, and one of the citys best restaurants of any cuisine. And the service-included philosophy is a lovely break from North Americas undignified and inequitable tipping culture. Improvements? Descriptions of the dishes in the menu, rather than as the dish is delivered, would benefit everyone: achingly cool though a four-word description is, many (those trying to lose weight or better control their diabetes, say) would appreciate knowing that tofu isnt tofu but rather made from carbs. The music could have been more compatible with the serene enjoyment of excellent food. And the portion sizes, especially dessert: it would have been lovely to have been able to enjoy, not just admire, something so good. But these are minor quibbles. Go. Eat. Its wonderful.
Unquestionably the best meal I ve had in a long time, vegan or otherwise. Vibrant, bold flavours and great presentation. Friendly and attentive service. Absolutely loved it. Definitely coming back.

Went here on yesterday on a Sunday night for a nice date and was blown away. Had a selection of excellent natural wines and ordered the tasting menu. Course after course inventive/novel uses of ingredients and impressive/inspiring flavour combinations. Liberal charring on bread and brocolli and spring onions and other things added even more dimension. Along with the excellent food, the classy, simple intimate space and friendly responsive staff (I think we met the whole team over the course of the meal who all seemed genuinely excited to share their talent with us) we left feeling satisfied in all ways. Probably the best vegan restaurant experience available in Vancouver right now.

I wish I had taken pictures of our meal but we were too busy enjoying it. We had the tasting menu and it was perfect. Every course better than the last. Gorgeous atmosphere and the most attentive staff. Here s the plus  NO tipping. The staff receive a living wage. I ll be back.

We loved Folke which featured (all vegan) sharing plates based around locally sourced vegetables and ingredients that were imaginative, truly delicious as well as being grounded in the local produce and cultural influences (soft toffee with nori sugar - scrumptious end to a meal!) Lots of lovely flavours that worked well together with attractive plating.  The charming and attentive staff were another draw. We loved that the final bill was inclusive of tip - simpler for the customer and (according to one of our lovely waiters) fairer for the staff. Almost, fabulous local wise (some organic - ask for pairings we have great recommendations). A brilliant modern take on West Coast cuisine.

My experience with Folke was amazing! The food was some of the best vegan eats I ve ever had, and everything was made in house. The potato and the tofu on the happy hour menu changed my life! The service was incredible too, and as a former server it was awesome to see servers working a salary job with benefits. This is what we need in this industry, thank you! Stoked to return soon!
Absolutely delicious food! Great service, nice ambience. Worth trying and coming back.
We were treated like special people and the food was great. Very unique vegan dishes

Folke is the best vegetarian (vegan) food Ive had in my life, and offers a tasting menu that ranks a Michelin rating and elevates the Kitsilano dining scene. The team presents creative and interesting takes on vegetables I thought I knew, and some Id never heard of. Dont miss the Summer Soda cocktail (created by our server).
FIVE STARS! They uphold everything that is relevant to todays dining experience and focus on what matters: the FOOD!

Incredible, warm, friendly and attentive service. Had the vegan tasting menu and absolutely loved all the dishes, especially the stuffed flatbread dish and potato pave, and the cherry jaffa cake dessert. I cannot wait to return! If this team can keep the standards up, they could win best restaurant in Canada. You wont be able to get a reservation at this place once word gets out so do yourself a favour and book a table now.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: We loved having you and Ed! Thank you for visiting us!

reviews.review_text: First time at Folke and had High Tea. Just a wonderful experience, amazing food and service was top notch. Love the sustainable wage and taxes included on the menu. A pleasant surprise and I applaud your efforts :)

Best new restaurant, hands down.  Absolutely delicious, every bite.  I highly recommend getting the tasting menu.  It takes the guess work out of what to order, and you get to try a little bit of almost everything, including dessert.

Folke is the BEST. The service = top tier, they have a great wine selection, and the tasting menu was delicious. The crew at Folke are also super accommodating to gluten free and other allergies/intolerances. I can t wait to go back.

A delicious and unique dining experience! Really great takes on staples with a fun blend of surprise and delight (eg seaweed caramel) treats, rounded out by one of the loveliest people I ve have had as a server (thank you Jessica!).

Impeccable. From the wine, to the food, to the genuine service. Every dish was better then the last, and you could feel the warmth from the staff. The bread, dumplings, turnips and the rhubarb dessert were all standouts. Thank you for sharing this veggie magic with people.
This place was perfect from start to finish. Amazing service, unbelievable food and a lovely setting. We will definitely be back!

This place is incredible.  People complaining about portion size dont understand or appreciate the work that goes into making each dish. Every element on the plate is either elevated or transformed.  Many processes are involved in making one dish.  Lots of careful attention to detail, time and passion. Not to mention, they are going out to farms and talking to suppliers about what is fresh to use on the menu.  Thats time and that costs $. If you want to eat at a place that gets its food from a mass supplier, this is not the place for it. If your goal is to stuff yourself at a low price you miss the point of a restaurant like this (although you will be full and happy if you go for the tasting menu like we did - sit at the chefs counter so you can see art in action).  This place is amazing. The homemade chicpea tofu was delicious af.  The seasoning was perfect. They are not trying to pass off a dish as something else.  Its elevated, creative, delicious and beautifully presented.  Its not a great Vegan restaurant, its a great RESTAURANT.

One of Vancouvers finest restaurants, vegan or otherwise. Everything Ive tried here is very flavorful and delicious. Spectacular presentation and attentive service. Theyve taken the less is more approach to their menu, which is annoying. Be sure to ask the server about everything that comes with what youre ordering.

Amazing! The best meal Ive had in ages. Wonderfully presented, and absolutely delicious. No compromise in service levels with the gratuity being included in the pricing. Fantastic addition to the neighborhood.
Great little restaurant! I m not a vegan but the food was delicious. The carrots! The pickles! We tried the tasting menu and it was such a fun experience. Definitely recommend
Absolute treasure of a place. Wonderful food, tasty cocktails and lovely staff. Thank you and see you soon!
Fantastic and fresh vegan menu. Great selection of wines and drinks. All around a welcomed new vegan casual fine dining restaurant in the same class as The Acorn and Nightshade.

What a great experience. The food is excellent, the servers are very knowledgeable about allergies (they can accommodate gluten free very easily), and the no-tipping model is great. Will definitely be back!
What an AMAZING experience! Food is delicious, creative with beautiful flavours. Excellent and friendly customer service. I would go back there in a heartbeat. Desserts are a must try, all of them :)

We just had a great experience at Folke. Food and drinks were so savory and delicious, and the staff were very friendly. Its great to hear the menu will be changing weekly or so based on whatever is most fresh. Were keen to back and try whatever is next!!
